intro: Descurainia sophia subsp. sophia, commonly known as sweet coltsfoot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and branched. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in racemes, blooming in early spring. The plant is often found in meadows, roadsides, and other disturbed soils.
